intro: Phlegmariurus taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan haircap moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows on moist, shaded rocky or soil surfaces. The plant has a dense, cushion-like structure with closely packed, hair-like leaves that are usually green or reddish in color. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in humid environments and its resistance to desiccation. This species is native to Taiwan and is often found in forested areas with high moisture levels.
